Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And if a man also strive for masteries, yet is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Therefore I endure all things for the elect’s sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master’s use, and prepared unto every good work.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy, 3:3 Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts, 3:7 Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all men, as theirs also was.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I charge thee therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Do thy diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity.  Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other places;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: According to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies, 2:2 Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeed is not grievous, but for you it is safe.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the concision.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh. If any other man thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh, I more: 3:5 Circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, an Hebrew of the Hebrews; as touching the law, a Pharisee;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Concerning zeal, persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But what things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Yea doubtless, and I count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but dung, that I may win Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And be found in him, not having mine own righteousness, which is of the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is of God by faith:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: That I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being made conformable unto his death;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: If by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let us therefore, as many as be perfect, be thus minded: and if in any thing ye be otherwise minded, God shall reveal even this unto you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Nevertheless, whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: (For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ: 3:19 Whose end is destruction, whose God is their belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things.)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and with other my fellowlabourers, whose names are in the book of life.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, do: and the God of peace shall be with you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care of me hath flourished again; wherein ye were also careful, but ye lacked opportunity.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: every where and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate with my affliction.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Now ye Philippians know also, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But I have all, and abound: I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren which are with me greet you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
Text: All the saints salute you, chiefly they that are of Caesar’s household.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers, 1:5 Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Philemon
Text: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: The children of thy elect sister greet thee. Amen.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.

Book: The Third Epistle General of John
Text: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Of which salvation the prophets have enquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace that should come unto you:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man’s work, pass the time of your sojourning here in fear:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold, from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, see that ye love one another with a pure heart fervently:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For all flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, all evil speakings,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: To whom coming, as unto a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, and precious,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Unto you therefore which believe he is precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, even to them which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Which in time past were not a people, but are now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Dearly beloved, I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord’s sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As free, and not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Honour all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For this is thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For what glory is it, if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer for it, ye take it patiently, this is acceptable with God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps: 2:22 Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed himself to him that judgeth righteously:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Finally, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, be pitiful, be courteous:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And who is he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But and if ye suffer for righteousness’ sake, happy are ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: That he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries: 4:4 Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with them to the same excess of riot, speaking evil of you:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Use hospitality one to another without grudging.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: As every man hath received the gift, even so minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: If any man speak, let him speak as the oracles of God; if any man minister, let him do it as of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ’s sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy are ye; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, or as a thief, or as an evildoer, or as a busybody in other men’s matters.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Yet if any man suffer as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: For the time is come that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them that obey not the gospel of God?

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls to him in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight thereof, not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Neither as being lords over God’s heritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder. Yea, all of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: Whom resist stedfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren that are in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle you.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: To him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: By Silvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I suppose, I have written briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein ye stand.

Book: The First Epistle General of Peter
Text: The church that is at Babylon, elected together with you, saluteth you; and so doth Marcus my son.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Grace be with you all. Amen.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted: 1:10 But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment; 2:3 And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent them out another way?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Behold, we put bits in the horses’ mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things.  Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Go to now, ye rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Ye have condemned and killed the just; and he doth not resist you.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord.  Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and your nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.

Book: The General Epistle of James
Text: Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse: 1:21 Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
