Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But now is Christ risen from the dead, and become the firstfruits of them that slept.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ’s at his coming.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Then cometh the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead? 15:30 And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our LORD, I die daily.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But some man will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other grain:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, and another of birds.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam was made a quickening spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Howbeit that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The first man is of the earth, earthy; the second man is the Lord from heaven.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: O death, where is thy sting? O grave, where is thy victory?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Let all your things be done with charity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity. Peace be with you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make you that ye shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know them, and be established in the present truth.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but cast them down to hell, and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned them with an overthrow, making them an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuous are they, selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not; and shall utterly perish in their own corruption;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Bosor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with man’s voice forbad the madness of the prophet.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through much wantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after they have known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered unto them.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But it is happened unto them according to the true proverb, The dog is turned to his own vomit again; and the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: This second epistle, beloved, I now write unto you; in both which I stir up your pure minds by way of remembrance:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: That ye may be mindful of the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of us the apostles of the Lord and Saviour: 3:3 Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And saying, Where is the promise of his coming? for since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: For this they willingly are ignorant of, that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished:

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But the heavens and the earth, which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Seeing then that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be in all holy conversation and godliness, 3:12 Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of God, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Nevertheless we, according to his promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: And account that the longsuffering of our Lord is salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also according to the wisdom given unto him hath written unto you;

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: As also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things; in which are some things hard to be understood, which they that are unlearned and unstable wrest, as they do also the other scriptures, unto their own destruction.

Book: The Second General Epistle of Peter
Text: Ye therefore, beloved, seeing ye know these things before, beware lest ye also, being led away with the error of the wicked, fall from your own stedfastness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, which is our hope;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Unto Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: As I besought thee to abide still at Ephesus, when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some that they teach no other doctrine,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith: so do.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart, and of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: From which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully; 1:9 Knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine; 1:11 According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who hath enabled me, for that he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This is a faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies which went before on thee, that thou by them mightest war a good warfare;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Holding faith, and a good conscience; which some having put away concerning faith have made shipwreck:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Whereunto I am ordained a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the truth in Christ, and lie not;) a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I will therefore that men pray every where, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This is a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity; 3:5 (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Likewise must the deacons be grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, being found blameless.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Even so must their wives be grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: These things command and teach.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Rebuke not an elder, but intreat him as a father; and the younger men as brethren;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints’ feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourer is worthy of his reward.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I charge thee before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men’s sins: keep thyself pure.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake and thine often infirmities.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Some men’s sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some men they follow after.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Likewise also the good works of some are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and his doctrine be not blasphemed.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That thou keep this commandment without spot, unrebukable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to Timothy
Text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Remembering without ceasing your work of faith, and labour of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, in the sight of God and our Father;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Knowing, brethren beloved, your election of God.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Ghost, and in much assurance; as ye know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: So that ye were ensamples to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For from you sounded out the word of the Lord not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith to God-ward is spread abroad; so that we need not to speak any thing.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For they themselves shew of us what manner of entering in we had unto you, and how ye turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, even Jesus, which delivered us from the wrath to come.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But even after that we had suffered before, and were shamefully entreated, as ye know, at Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God with much contention.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For our exhortation was not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But as we were allowed of God to be put in trust with the gospel, even so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, which trieth our hearts.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; God is witness:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Nor of men sought we glory, neither of you, nor yet of others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: So being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Ye are witnesses, and God also, how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: As ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a father doth his children,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye received it not as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judaea are in Christ Jesus: for ye also have suffered like things of your own countrymen, even as they have of the Jews:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Are not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye are our glory and joy.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left at Athens alone;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And sent Timotheus, our brother, and minister of God, and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That no man should be moved by these afflictions: for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For verily, when we were with you, we told you before that we should suffer tribulation; even as it came to pass, and ye know.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this cause, when I could no longer forbear, I sent to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter have tempted you, and our labour be in vain.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But now when Timotheus came from you unto us, and brought us good tidings of your faith and charity, and that ye have good remembrance of us always, desiring greatly to see us, as we also to see you: 3:7 Therefore, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For what thanks can we render to God again for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Night and day praying exceedingly that we might see your face, and might perfect that which is lacking in your faith?

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we do toward you:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: To the end he may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all his saints.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Furthermore then we beseech you, brethren, and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, so ye would abound more and more.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For ye know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this is the will of God, even your sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Not in the lust of concupiscence, even as the Gentiles which know not God: 4:6 That no man go beyond and defraud his brother in any matter: because that the Lord is the avenger of all such, as we also have forewarned you and testified.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: He therefore that despiseth, despiseth not man, but God, who hath also given unto us his holy Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But as touching brotherly love ye need not that I write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And indeed ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all Macedonia: but we beseech you, brethren, that ye increase more and more;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack of nothing.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as others which have no hope.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we which are alive and remain unto the coming of the Lord shall not prevent them which are asleep.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Then we which are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And to esteem them very highly in love for their work’s sake. And be at peace among yourselves.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Rejoice evermore.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Pray without ceasing.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Quench not the Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Despise not prophesyings.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Abstain from all appearance of evil.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Brethren, pray for us.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.

Book: The First Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Hath in these last days spoken unto us by his Son, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who being the brightness of his glory, and the express image of his person, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Being made so much better than the angels, as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For unto which of the angels said he at any time, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee? And again, I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And of the angels he saith, Who maketh his angels spirits, and his ministers a flame of fire.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But unto the Son he saith, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And, Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of thine hands:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: They shall perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And as a vesture shalt thou fold them up, and they shall be changed: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But to which of the angels said he at any time, Sit on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let them slip.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard him;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: God also bearing them witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man that thou visitest him?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him.  But now we see not yet all things put under him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For it became him, for whom are all things, and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified are all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren, 2:12 Saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For verily he took not on him the nature of angels; but he took on him the seed of Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto his brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses was faithful in all his house.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For every house is builded by some man; but he that built all things is God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And Moses verily was faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.) 3:12 Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But with whom was he grieved forty years? was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left us of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard it.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For we which have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And in this place again, If they shall enter into my rest.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God did from his.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our profession.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, as was Aaron.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest; but he that said unto him, Thou art my Son, to day have I begotten thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: As he saith also in another place, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and was heard in that he feared;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For every one that useth milk is unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And this will we do, if God permit.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But that which beareth thorns and briers is rejected, and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be burned.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath: 6:18 That by two immutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now consider how great this man was, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And here men that die receive tithes; but there he receiveth them, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For he testifieth, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
