Text: For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope did; by the which we draw nigh unto God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And inasmuch as not without an oath he was made priest:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people’s: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, maketh the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: A minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore it is of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in my covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein was the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein was the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But into the second went the high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and for the errors of the people:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: The Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Which was a figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Which stood only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of reformation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: How much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For where a testament is, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For a testament is of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Whereupon neither the first testament was dedicated without blood.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Saying, This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, which are the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein; which are offered by the law;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins: 10:12 But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh; 10:21 And having an high priest over the house of God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: He that despised Moses’ law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For we know him that hath said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For by it the elders obtained a good report.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as in a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of them, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son, 11:18 Of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called: 11:19 Accounting that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw he was a proper child; and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and of Barak, and of Samson, and of Jephthae; of David also, and Samuel, and of the prophets:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: (Of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and in mountains, and in dens and caves of the earth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit, that we might be partakers of his holiness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Lest there be any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which voice they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: (For they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And so terrible was the sight, that Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than that of Abel.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven: 12:26 Whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And this word, Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For our God is a consuming fire.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let brotherly love continue.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Marriage is honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: But I beseech you the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Hebrews
Text: Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints.  They of Italy salute you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.  Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That in the dispensation of the fulness of times he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom ye also trusted, after that ye heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love unto all the saints,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: The eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of his calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And what is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe, according to the working of his mighty power,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set him at his own right hand in the heavenly places,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And hath put all things under his feet, and gave him to be the head over all things to the church,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And you hath he quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherein in time past ye walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Among whom also we all had our conversation in times past in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind; and were by nature the children of wrath, even as others.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But God, who is rich in mercy, for his great love wherewith he loved us,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ, (by grace ye are saved;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And hath raised us up together, and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That in the ages to come he might shew the exceeding riches of his grace in his kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Not of works, lest any man should boast.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore remember, that ye being in time past Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by that which is called the Circumcision in the flesh made by hands;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That at that time ye were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But now in Christ Jesus ye who sometimes were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition between us;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Having abolished in his flesh the enmity, even the law of commandments contained in ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man, so making peace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And that he might reconcile both unto God in one body by the cross, having slain the enmity thereby:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And came and preached peace to you which were afar off, and to them that were nigh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner stone;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom all the building fitly framed together groweth unto an holy temple in the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom ye also are builded together for an habitation of God through the Spirit.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: If ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words, 3:4 Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel: 3:7 Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me by the effectual working of his power.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is this grace given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And to make all men see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the world hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: To the intent that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: May be able to comprehend with all saints what is the breadth, and length, and depth, and height;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fulness of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us, 3:21 Unto him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: I therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, beseech you that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: With all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, forbearing one another in love; 4:3 Endeavouring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: There is one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: One Lord, one faith, one baptism,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: One God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: (Now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: He that descended is the same also that ascended up far above all heavens, that he might fill all things.)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That we henceforth be no more children, tossed to and fro, and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the sleight of men, and cunning craftiness, whereby they lie in wait to deceive;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But speaking the truth in love, may grow up into him in all things, which is the head, even Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: From whom the whole body fitly joined together and compacted by that which every joint supplieth, according to the effectual working in the measure of every part, maketh increase of the body unto the edifying of itself in love.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that ye henceforth walk not as other Gentiles walk, in the vanity of their mind, 4:18 Having the understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Who being past feeling have given themselves over unto lasciviousness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But ye have not so learned Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: If so be that ye have heard him, and have been taught by him, as the truth is in Jesus: 4:22 That ye put off concerning the former conversation the old man, which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And that ye put on the new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Neither give place to the devil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Servants, be obedient to them that are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he be bond or free.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And, ye masters, do the same things unto them, forbearing threatening: knowing that your Master also is in heaven; neither is there respect of persons with him.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: And for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: For which I am an ambassador in bonds: that therein I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: But that ye also may know my affairs, and how I do, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, and that he might comfort your hearts.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Ephesians
Text: Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is meet, because that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the charity of every one of you all toward each other aboundeth;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: So that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that ye endure:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Which is a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God, that ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer: 1:6 Seeing it is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And to you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with his mighty angels,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness, and the work of faith with power:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now letteth will let, until he be taken out of the way.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Even him, whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: That they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified, even as it is with you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for all men have not faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Neither did we eat any man’s bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Thessalonians
Text: The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But as God is true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, is God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Sufficient to such a man is this punishment, which was inflicted of many.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So that contrariwise ye ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your love toward him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To whom ye forgive any thing, I forgive also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave it, for your sakes forgave I it in the person of Christ;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To the one we are the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who is sufficient for these things?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some others, epistles of commendation to you, or letters of commendation from you?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Forasmuch as ye are manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But if the ministration of death, written and engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which glory was to be done away:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if the ministration of condemnation be glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if that which is done away was glorious, much more that which remaineth is glorious.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And not as Moses, which put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the LORD.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
