Text: In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus’ sake.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus’ sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present us with you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing is God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore we are always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For whether we be beside ourselves, it is to God: or whether we be sober, it is for your cause.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And that he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we him no more.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And all things are of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech you by us: we pray you in Christ’s stead, be ye reconciled to God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: We then, as workers together with him, beseech you also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings; 6:6 By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and yet true;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: O ye Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto my children,) be ye also enlarged.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean thing; and I will receive you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I speak not this to condemn you: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings, within were fears.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though it were but for a season.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, what clearing of yourselves, yea, what indignation, yea, what fear, yea, what vehement desire, yea, what zeal, yea, what revenge! In all things ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, I did it not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which I made before Titus, is found a truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For to their power, I bear record, yea, and beyond their power they were willing of themselves;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And this they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And herein I give my advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now therefore perform the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to will, so there may be a performance also out of that which ye have.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if there be first a willing mind, it is accepted according to that a man hath, and not according to that he hath not.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I mean not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want, that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As it is written, He that had gathered much had nothing over; and he that had gathered little had no lack.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But thanks be to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which I have in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Whether any do enquire of Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren be enquired of, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as a matter of bounty, and not as of covetousness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But this I say, He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And God is able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for your food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal distribution unto them, and unto all men;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I beseech you, that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ’s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he is Christ’s, even so are we Christ’s.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For his letters, say they, are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But we will not boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we stretch not ourselves beyond our measure, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in preaching the gospel of Christ:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men’s labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man’s line of things made ready to our hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with him.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But though I be rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I robbed other churches, taking wages of them, to do you service.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and so will I keep myself.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: That which I speak, I speak it not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye yourselves are wise.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour you, if a man take of you, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Are they Hebrews? so am I. Are they Israelites? so am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so am I.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Of the Jews five times received I forty stripes save one.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep; 11:26 In journeyings often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by mine own countrymen, in perils by the heathen, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brethren;

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: This is the third time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. For we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates?

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Now I pray to God that ye do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as reprobates.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: For we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this also we wish, even your perfection.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the power which the Lord hath given me to edification, and not to destruction.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: Greet one another with an holy kiss.

Book: The Second Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Corinthians
Text: All the saints salute you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: (For the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and shew unto you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested unto us;)

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and do not the truth:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not.  And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But whoso keepeth his word, in him verily is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which ye have heard from the beginning.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Again, a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name’s sake.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I write unto you, fathers, because ye have known him that is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because ye have overcome the wicked one. I write unto you, little children, because ye have known the Father.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I have written unto you, fathers, because ye have known him that is from the beginning. I have written unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard that antichrist shall come, even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last time.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and ye know all things.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Who is a liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ? He is antichrist, that denieth the Father and the Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father: he that acknowledgeth the Son hath the Father also.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning. If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall remain in you, ye also shall continue in the Son, and in the Father.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the promise that he hath promised us, even eternal life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: These things have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But the anointing which ye have received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as it hath taught you, ye shall abide in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And now, little children, abide in him; that, when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that every one that doeth righteousness is born of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And every man that hath this hope in him purifieth himself, even as he is pure.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And ye know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen him, neither known him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, let no man deceive you: he that doeth righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doeth not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loveth not his brother.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For this is the message that ye heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Not as Cain, who was of that wicked one, and slew his brother. And wherefore slew he him? Because his own works were evil, and his brother’s righteous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Marvel not, my brethren, if the world hate you.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We know that we have passed from death unto life, because we love the brethren. He that loveth not his brother abideth in death.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: But whoso hath this world’s good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels of compassion from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart, and knoweth all things.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is his commandment, That we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as he gave us commandment.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him, and he in him.  And hereby we know that he abideth in us, by the Spirit which he hath given us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby know ye the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And every spirit that confesseth not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is not of God: and this is that spirit of antichrist, whereof ye have heard that it should come; and even now already is it in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us. God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We love him, because he first loved us.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: This is he that came by water and blood, even Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: For there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these three are one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And there are three that bear witness in earth, the Spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these three agree in one.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name of the Son of God.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: If any man see his brother sin a sin which is not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto death. There is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for it.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: All unrighteousness is sin: and there is a sin not unto death.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not; but he that is begotten of God keepeth himself, and that wicked one toucheth him not.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we know that we are of God, and the whole world lieth in wickedness.

Book: The First Epistle General of John
Text: And we know that the Son of God is come, and hath given us an understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him that is true, even in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God, and eternal life.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: The elder unto the elect lady and her children, whom I love in the truth; and not I only, but also all they that have known the truth;

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: For the truth’s sake, which dwelleth in us, and shall be with us for ever.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: And now I beseech thee, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment unto thee, but that which we had from the beginning, that we love one another.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: And this is love, that we walk after his commandments. This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: For many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an antichrist.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Look to yourselves, that we lose not those things which we have wrought, but that we receive a full reward.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God. He that abideth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: If there come any unto you, and bring not this doctrine, receive him not into your house, neither bid him God speed:

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: For he that biddeth him God speed is partaker of his evil deeds.

Book: The Second Epistle General of John
Text: Having many things to write unto you, I would not write with paper and ink: but I trust to come unto you, and speak face to face, that our joy may be full.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia: 1:3 Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: As we said before, so say I now again, if any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And profited in the Jews’ religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And they glorified God in me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no man’s person:) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference added nothing to me:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as the gospel of the circumcision was unto Peter;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: (For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:) 2:9 And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Only they would that we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter before them all, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is therefore Christ the minister of sin? God forbid.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I am crucified with Christ: neverthless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, doeth he it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham, saying, In thee shall all nations be blessed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse: for it is written, Cursed is every one that continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God, it is evident: for, The just shall live by faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And the law is not of faith: but, The man that doeth them shall live in them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men; Though it be but a man’s covenant, yet if it be confirmed, no man disannulleth, or addeth thereto.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made. He saith not, And to seeds, as of many; but as of one, And to thy seed, which is Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And this I say, that the covenant, that was confirmed before of God in Christ, the law, which was four hundred and thirty years after, cannot disannul, that it should make the promise of none effect.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For if the inheritance be of the law, it is no more of promise: but God gave it to Abraham by promise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Wherefore then serveth the law? It was added because of transgressions, till the seed should come to whom the promise was made; and it was ordained by angels in the hand of a mediator.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now a mediator is not a mediator of one, but God is one.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid: for if there had been a law given which could have given life, verily righteousness should have been by the law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But the scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to them that believe.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But before faith came, we were kept under the law, shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Wherefore the law was our schoolmaster to bring us unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But after that faith is come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And if ye be Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now I say, That the heir, as long as he is a child, differeth nothing from a servant, though he be lord of all;

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed of the father.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world:

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman, made under the law,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And because ye are sons, God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Wherefore thou art no more a servant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Howbeit then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But now, after that ye have known God, or rather are known of God, how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements, whereunto ye desire again to be in bondage?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Brethren, I beseech you, be as I am; for I am as ye are: ye have not injured me at all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Ye know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel unto you at the first.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected; but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Where is then the blessedness ye spake of? for I bear you record, that, if it had been possible, ye would have plucked out your own eyes, and have given them to me.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Am I therefore become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: They zealously affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But it is good to be zealously affected always in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: My little children, of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I desire to be present with you now, and to change my voice; for I stand in doubt of you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Tell me, ye that desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For it is written, that Abraham had two sons, the one by a bondmaid, the other by a freewoman.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But he who was of the bondwoman was born after the flesh; but he of the freewoman was by promise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For this Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and answereth to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But Jerusalem which is above is free, which is the mother of us all.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For it is written, Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the Spirit, even so it is now.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Nevertheless what saith the scripture? Cast out the bondwoman and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of the free.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Behold, I Paul say unto you, that if ye be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For I testify again to every man that is circumcised, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Christ is become of no effect unto you, whosoever of you are justified by the law; ye are fallen from grace.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision; but faith which worketh by love.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Ye did run well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the truth?

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: This persuasion cometh not of him that calleth you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I have confidence in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution? then is the offence of the cross ceased.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: I would they were even cut off which trouble you.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For, brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but by love serve one another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: This I say then, Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that ye cannot do the things that ye would.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But if ye be led of the Spirit, ye are not under the law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are these; Adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Envyings, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told you in time past, that they which do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And they that are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with the affections and lusts.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For every man shall bear his own burden.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: As many as desire to make a fair shew in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law; but desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace be on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

Book: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Galatians
Text: From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
